comments: Number of compositions of n into parts 3, 4, 5, and 6. - _David Neil McGrath_, Aug 17 2014
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,1,1,1,1).
formula: a(n) = a(n-6) + a(n-5) + a(n-4) + a(n-3). - _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Aug 07 2006a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-4) + {1, -1, or 0} depending on whether n mod 3 is {0, 1, or 2}. - _Barry Cipra_, Mar 03 2008
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[1 / (1 - Total[x^Range[3, 6]]), {x, 0, 50}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jun 27 2013 *)LinearRecurrence[{0,0,1,1,1,1},{1,0,0,1,1,1},50] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Aug 15 2014 *)
prog: (MAGMA) m:=50; R<x>:=PowerSeriesRing(Integers(), m); Coefficients(R!(1/((1-x^3-x^4-x^5-x^6)))); /* or */ I:=[1,0,0,1,1,1]; [n le 6 select I[n] else Self(n-3)+Self(n-4)+Self(n-5)+Self(n-6): n in [1..50]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jun 27 2013(PARI) Vec(1/(1-x^3-x^4-x^5-x^6)+ O(x^60)) \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 17 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
